greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Shift one instance of the largest prime one step towards smaller primes: a(1) = 1, a(2^n) = 2^(n-1), and for other numbers: a(n) = (n / prime(g)) * prime(g-1), where g = A061395(n), index of the greatest prime dividing n.
comment: Iterating from any n as a(n), a(a(n)), a(a(a(n))), etc. reaches 1 after A056239(n) iterations.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(1) = 1; for n>1: a(n) = A008578(A061395(n)) * A052126(n). [Compare to the similar formula given for A064989.]
For n >= 2, A001222(a(n)) = A001222(n) - A209229(n). [Number of prime divisors decreases only when n is a power of 2 larger than 1.]
mathematica: Array[a, n]]; a252462[84] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 21 2014 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 20 2014
